name: mergeable
description: Mergeable is a self-hosted change request and merge management system for Git repositories. It allows teams to manage merge requests with approval workflows and integrates with Git servers.
features: Merge request management: Track and review code changes with pull request workflows.
Approval workflows: Configure required approvals before merges can be completed.
Git integration: Connect to Git servers like GitLab, Gitea, or GitHub for repository access.
Code review tools: Comment on specific lines, suggest changes, and discuss modifications.
Status checks: Integrate with CI/CD pipelines to require passing tests before merge.
Branch protection: Enforce rules like required reviews or status checks on protected branches.
Conflict detection: Identify merge conflicts and provide tools for resolution.
Activity tracking: View history of comments, approvals, and changes on each merge request.
Notification system: Alert reviewers and authors about new requests, comments, or approvals.
Search and filtering: Find merge requests by status, author, reviewer, or branch name.
API access: Automate merge request workflows through programmatic API.
Multi-repository support: Manage merge requests across multiple Git repositories.
